itemDescription: great-grandfather of Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom

wikipedia_page.main:
Charles William Frederick Cavendish-Bentinck (8 November 1817 – 17 August 1865) was a clergyman of the Church of England, holding livings in Bedfordshire, and a great-grandfather of Queen Elizabeth II.
Bentinck often gave his names as William Charles Cavendish Bentinck, resulting in his unique "W. C. C. Bentinck" signature. He rarely used the Cavendish-Bentinck surname.
